privacy_invasive_user_journey.background: Tuesday evening, 8 p.m. Rosa has just finished a long shift at her housekeeping job and is relaxing in her shared apartment's living-room computer nook. She hopes music will ease her homesickness and help her feel closer to her small circle of Guatemalan friends in the U.S. Her goal tonight is to see what her friends are listening to, share her own music to spark conversation, and widen her support network without revealing her undocumented status.

scenes.scene_description: Rosa decides to let trusted friends see the cumbia playlist she has been curating. 'I'll just flip on that one setting—only my initials show anyway,' she reassures herself.

scene_user_flow.start: Launch music app on desktop from the Windows taskbar.
scene_user_flow.interface: Home page

scene_user_flow.action: Click on her circular profile picture in the top-right corner.
scene_user_flow.interface: A drop-down menu appears with options: Account, Profile, Upgrade to Premium, Support, Private Session, Settings, Log out.
Settings page showing sections such as Account, Language, Social, Display …
Buttons appear: 'Publish my new playlists on my profile' (ON), 'Start a private session' (OFF), 'Share my listening activity' (OFF), etc.

scene_user_flow.action: Toggle 'Share my listening activity' to ON.
scene_user_flow.system_action: App checks for mutual friends who already share listening activity.
scene_user_flow.interface: 'Share my listening activity' now reads ON.
Settings page stays open with the toggle switched ON.
scene_user_flow.true_reasoning: Activity sharing is enabled, satisfying Rosa's first goal.
scene_user_flow.next_step: Rosa wants to see her friends' tracks in real time.

scenes.reflections: A small thrill—she imagines friends seeing her upbeat playlist. Yet a knot forms: 'Hope nothing else slips out …'

scenes.scene_description: To view friends' music, Rosa turns on the sidebar feature she once ignored. She expects an intimate glimpse into friends' moods tonight.

scene_user_flow.start: Still on Settings page, finger on the scroll wheel.
scene_user_flow.interface: Settings page
Three toggles appear: 'Show the now-playing panel …' (ON), 'Canvas' (ON), 'See what your friends are playing' (OFF).

scene_user_flow.action: Switch 'See what your friends are playing' to ON.
scene_user_flow.system_action: App confirms mutual friends have sharing enabled.
scene_user_flow.interface: Friend Activity sidebar pops open, listing friends and their tracks from the past week.
Friend Activity sidebar remains visible with friends' avatars and song titles.
scene_user_flow.true_reasoning: Sidebar successfully displays friends' recent listening.
scene_user_flow.next_step: Rosa notices only two friends listed. She decides to add more through Facebook.

scenes.reflections: Excited to see familiar names, she muses: 'If I connect Facebook, more gente might show up.' Tension resurfaces about linking real accounts.

scenes.scene_description: Hoping for a richer feed, Rosa links her dormant Facebook. She believes the app's claim—'We'll never post without permission.'

scene_user_flow.start: Friend Activity sidebar showing an 'Add Friends' button.
scene_user_flow.interface: Friend Activity sidebar with 'Add Friends'.
Large blue 'Connect with Facebook' button appears with reassurance message.
Facebook login pop-up prompts for email and password.

scene_user_flow.action: Enter Facebook credentials and press 'Log In'.
scene_user_flow.system_action: App requests access to name, profile picture, and friend list; Facebook authorizes.
scene_user_flow.interface: Friend Activity sidebar refreshes, now displaying a longer list of friends and their music.
Sidebar scrolls to reveal coworkers and distant relatives listening live.
scene_user_flow.true_reasoning: Facebook friends are synced and visible.
scene_user_flow.next_step: Rosa sees a coworker's name pop up; uneasy, she tries to remove him from her feed.

scenes.reflections: Heart jumps—her coworker Luis (who doesn't know she's undocumented) just appeared. 'That was fast … maybe I can quietly hide him.'

scenes.scene_description: Rosa attempts a subtle removal but misunderstands the interface, expecting 'Report' to hide Luis.

scene_user_flow.start: Sidebar still open with Luis's activity visible.
scene_user_flow.interface: Friend Activity sidebar
Luis's profile page appears; 'Following' button and three-dot 'More' icon visible.
Drop-down menu: Unfollow, Block, Report, Copy Link to Profile.
Menu closes; profile page remains unchanged.
Friend Activity sidebar still shows Luis streaming music.
scene_user_flow.false_reasoning: Reporting does not remove or block the user from Friend Activity.
scene_user_flow.next_step: Frustrated, Rosa opts to hide all future activity by starting a Private Session.

scenes.reflections: Embarrassed and nervous—'He might see everything I play, right now.' She feels trapped by the interface jargon.

scenes.scene_description: Quick damage control: Rosa starts a Private Session, praying it truly hides current listening.

scene_user_flow.interface: Profile page with top-right profile picture.
Drop-down menu with seven options including 'Private Session'.
Drop-down disappears; a blue padlock icon appears on the Top App Bar.
Blue padlock icon persists on the bar.
scene_user_flow.true_reasoning: Icon confirms Private Session is active, stopping further sharing.
scene_user_flow.next_step: Rosa sighs in relief and closes the app after a few songs.

scenes.reflections: Relief battles dread—'Did Luis already catch my username on that cumbia track?' She vows not to reconnect Facebook again.

privacy_invasive_user_journey.unexpected_outcomes:
Within minutes of connecting Facebook, the coworker Luis receives an in-app notification that 'RMartinez' is now on the platform, complete with Rosa's Facebook-derived profile picture that clearly shows her face. Luis, surprised to see a normally private colleague, takes a screenshot of the Friend Activity sidebar displaying Rosa's late-night listening and shares it in a group chat with other staff members to joke about her 'nostalgic Spanish-language jams.' Rosa's sensitive data exposed: 
• **Sensitive data**: Real-name profile photo (reveals identity), Spanish-language music choices (implying ethnicity), and timestamped late-night activity (suggesting current location/home hours). 
• **Data subject**: Rosa Martínez. 
• **Data sender**: Music app automatically pushed Rosa's synced identity and live listening status. 
• **Data recipient**: Coworker Luis, who further disseminated the screenshot to additional coworkers. 
This chain breaks Rosa's careful identity management, heightening the risk that workplace rumors reach human-resources staff—potentially leading to background checks that could expose her undocumented status.
